basics.name: David Aslan
basics.label: Full-Stack Developer
basics.summary: I am a pragmatic full-stack Java/.NET developer with strengths in IT, administration, sales, and customer service. My focus is modern web and backend development, with an interest in lower-level languages and hardware-related projects. Based in Stockholm, I thrive in flexible, challenge-driven environments and aim for elegant simplicity, solid architecture, and reliable logging in the software I build.

work.name: Quintic Ab
work.summary: Developed a scalable e-commerce platform for custom 3D-printing orders using Next.js, Sanity CMS, and internationalization (i18n) to support multiple languages. Created a new landing page for a Quintic subsidiary using Next.js. Converted legacy building plans into CAD format with customer-specific modifications, enabling approved home remodels through Stockholm city.
highlights: Developed scalable e-commerce platform for custom 3D-printing orders
Created new landing page for Quintic subsidiary
Converted legacy building plans into CAD format with customer-specific modifications

work.name: Loggamera Ab
work.summary: Implemented a gradual migration from Bootstrap 3.1 to 5 across 500+ frontend pages using continuous integration, with zero disruption to weekly releases. Integrated new hardware devices into Loggamera's IMD software, expanding system compatibility. Delivered new features and resolved customer-reported bugs, enhancing UX and reducing support overhead.
highlights: Migrated Bootstrap 3.1 to 5 across 500+ frontend pages with zero disruption
Integrated new hardware devices into IMD software
Delivered new features and resolved customer-reported bugs

work.name: Värmeverket
work.summary: Collaborated with the design team to make well-informed decisions that met both performance and style requirements. Migrated our slow Webflow site to a fast, SEO-optimized Next.js site with the newly agreed-upon design and managed content using Storyblok CMS. Also built a specialized visitor tracking system to monitor the number of people in the building in case of an emergency.
highlights: Migrated slow Webflow site to fast, SEO-optimized Next.js site
Built specialized visitor tracking system for emergency monitoring
Collaborated with design team for performance and style optimization

work.name: Telenor
work.summary: Handled B2B/B2C sales and served as the dedicated point of contact for business clients at Telenor, building long-term professional relationships. Achieved consumer sales targets through in-store engagement and personalized service. Maintained store operations, including inventory management, handling deliveries, and addressing theft-related issues.
highlights: Handled B2B/B2C sales and served as dedicated point of contact for business clients
Achieved consumer sales targets through in-store engagement
Maintained store operations including inventory management

projects.name: 3D Printing E-commerce Platform
projects.description: Developed a scalable e-commerce platform for custom 3D-printing orders using Next.js, Sanity CMS, and internationalization (i18n) to support multiple languages.
highlights: Scalable architecture for custom 3D-printing orders
Multi-language support with i18n
Integration with Sanity CMS

projects.name: Bootstrap Migration Project
projects.description: Implemented a gradual migration from Bootstrap 3.1 to 5 across 500+ frontend pages using continuous integration, with zero disruption to weekly releases.
highlights: Migrated 500+ frontend pages
Zero disruption to weekly releases
Continuous integration implementation

projects.name: Racing Game in Unreal Engine 5
projects.description: Team project where we built a small racing game in Unreal Engine 5 as part of the Technical Art program.
highlights: Team collaboration on game development
Unreal Engine 5 implementation
Complete game development cycle
